speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: SCENE VII. A tent in the French camp. LEAR on a bed asleep,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: soft music playing; Gentleman, and others attending.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter CORDELIA, KENT, and Doctor

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: O thou good Kent, how shall I live and work,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To match thy goodness? My life will be too short,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: And every measure fail me.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To be acknowledged, madam, is o'erpaid.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: All my reports go with the modest truth;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Nor more nor clipp'd, but so.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Be better suited:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: These weeds are memories of those worser hours:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: I prithee, put them off.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Pardon me, dear madam;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Yet to be known shortens my made intent:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My boon I make it, that you know me not

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Till time and I think meet.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Then be't so, my good lord.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To the Doctor

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: How does the king?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Madam, sleeps still.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: O you kind gods,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Cure this great breach in his abused nature!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: The untuned and jarring senses, O, wind up

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Of this child-changed father!

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: So please your majesty

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: That we may wake the king: he hath slept long.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Be govern'd by your knowledge, and proceed

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: I' the sway of your own will. Is he array'd?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Ay, madam; in the heaviness of his sleep

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: We put fresh garments on him.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Be by, good madam, when we do awake him;

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: I doubt not of his temperance.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Very well.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Please you, draw near. Louder the music there!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: O my dear father! Restoration hang

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Thy medicine on my lips; and let this kiss

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Repair those violent harms that my two sisters

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Have in thy reverence made!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Kind and dear princess!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Had you not been their father, these white flakes

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Had challenged pity of them. Was this a face

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To be opposed against the warring winds?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To stand against the deep dread-bolted thunder?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: In the most terrible and nimble stroke

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Of quick, cross lightning? to watch--poor perdu!--

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: With this thin helm? Mine enemy's dog,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Though he had bit me, should have stood that night

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Against my fire; and wast thou fain, poor father,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To hovel thee with swine, and rogues forlorn,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: In short and musty straw? Alack, alack!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: 'Tis wonder that thy life and wits at once

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Had not concluded all. He wakes; speak to him.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Madam, do you; 'tis fittest.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: How does my royal lord? How fares your majesty?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You do me wrong to take me out o' the grave:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou art a soul in bliss; but I am bound

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Upon a wheel of fire, that mine own tears

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do scald like moulten lead.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Sir, do you know me?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You are a spirit, I know: when did you die?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Still, still, far wide!

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: He's scarce awake: let him alone awhile.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Where have I been? Where am I? Fair daylight?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I am mightily abused. I should e'en die with pity,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To see another thus. I know not what to say.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will not swear these are my hands: let's see;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I feel this pin prick. Would I were assured

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Of my condition!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: O, look upon me, sir,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: And hold your hands in benediction o'er me:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: No, sir, you must not kneel.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pray, do not mock me:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I am a very foolish fond old man,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Fourscore and upward, not an hour more nor less;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And, to deal plainly,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I fear I am not in my perfect mind.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Methinks I should know you, and know this man;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Yet I am doubtful for I am mainly ignorant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What place this is; and all the skill I have

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Remembers not these garments; nor I know not

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Where I did lodge last night. Do not laugh at me;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For, as I am a man, I think this lady

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To be my child Cordelia.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: And so I am, I am.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Be your tears wet? yes, 'faith. I pray, weep not:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If you have poison for me, I will drink it.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I know you do not love me; for your sisters

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Have, as I do remember, done me wrong:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You have some cause, they have not.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: No cause, no cause.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Am I in France?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: In your own kingdom, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do not abuse me.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Be comforted, good madam: the great rage,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: You see, is kill'd in him: and yet it is danger

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: To make him even o'er the time he has lost.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Desire him to go in; trouble him no more

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Till further settling.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Will't please your highness walk?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You must bear with me:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pray you now, forget and forgive: I am old and foolish.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt all but KENT and Gentleman

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Holds it true, sir, that the Duke of Cornwall was so slain?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Most certain, sir.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Who is conductor of his people?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: As 'tis said, the bastard son of Gloucester.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: They say Edgar, his banished son, is with the Earl

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: of Kent in Germany.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Report is changeable. 'Tis time to look about; the

speaker: KENT
text_entry: powers of the kingdom approach apace.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The arbitrement is like to be bloody. Fare you

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: well, sir.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My point and period will be throughly wrought,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Or well or ill, as this day's battle's fought.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exit
